result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremiah J Button was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault) [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).
  • Possession of Child Pornography [Modifiers: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders], a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.12(1m).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: 1st Degree Sexual Assault of Child Under Age of 12

chargeModifiers.descr: Lifetime Supervision of Serious Sex Offenders

supervisions.notes: Condition of Confinement: Have no contact with A.M.B., her mother, J.B. or her brother J.B.

superMiscConds.notes: Defendant is required to authorize the department to collect funds from the defendant's wages and from other moneys held in the defendant's prisoner's account to be used for payment of obligations in reasonable amounts as determined by DOC. If any fines, costs, surcharges, & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil Judgment will be entered against the Defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

- Have no contact with A.M.B., her mother, J.B. or her brother J.B. unless they consent and your agent consents.
- Comply with all assessments and treatment deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections and its agents. This would include psychosexual evaluation if requested, AODA, psychological evaluation and sex offender treatment and any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent or the Department of Corrections.
Not to engage in any occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires you to work or interact primarily and directly with children under the age of 16.
- No contact with children under the age of 18 without the agent's consent.
- Reimburse up to $10,000 the cost of any necessary professional services related to psychiatric and psychological care and services for A.M.B. pursuant to 973.20(4m).
- Comply with sex offender registry.
- Sign all releases of information that the agent requires to monitor compliance.
- Provide DNA Sample if requested.
- All computers and hard drives and other contraband recovered and seized in this matter is to be forfeited.
- Lifetime supervision is necessary.

Defendant Jeremiah J Button in court with Attorney (Atty) Jessica Phelps and Attorney Anne Renc. Defendant Jeremiah J Button in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Exhibits #1-#3 are marked on behalf of the Petitioner prior to the start of Court.

1:31 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

This matter is set for sentencing today.
Court has received a number of letters from the Defendant's family and mother of the victim A.M.B.

State received the letters.
Court received the victim impact statement of the mother, A.M.B.
Atty Phelps received the statement as well as filed an additional letter. 

Court did not review the letter.
Atty Phelps indicated that the letter may have been filed this morning.
Atty Phelps hands a copy of the letter to the Court and Prosecutor. 

These are open hearings, press is welcome to attend. Two of the local TV stations are present, after granting prior permission by the Court. 
Court prohibits recording of victim's statement or victim family member unless that individual consents, through the Victim Witness Coordinator.

Court will take a moment to review the letter from Miss Miller. 

Court does want to be sensitive to the rights and needs of the victim, hence the reason for the prohibitions previously stated. 

Atty Phelps addresses the Court, clarifies that two of the family members intend to present testimony.

1:37 PM A.H. is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Phelps.

1:44 PM L.B. is called and sworn in.
Direct examination by Atty Phelps.

Defense has no further witnesses.

State has the victim impact statement but no further testimony.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court, victim is not opposed to the media filming or recording her voice during the statement.

1:53 PM A.M.B. makes statement.

Court did receive a statement from J.B.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes sentence recommendations.
Exhibits #1 through #3 are referred to.
Crime victim services has not been involved in this case. 
Parties address days credit.

Atty Phelps addresses the Court prior to sentencing, makes sentence recommendations, this is a joint recommendation.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 45 years
Initial Confinement for 25 years
Condition of Confinement: Have no contact with A.M.B., her mother, J.B. or her brother J.B. 
Extended Supervision for 20 years 
230 Days Jail Credit 
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Have no contact with A.M.B., her mother, J.B. or her brother J.B. unless they consent and your agent consents.
Comply with all assessments and treatment deemed appropriate by the Department of Corrections and its agents. This would include psychosexual evaluation if requested, AODA, psychological evaluation and sex offender treatment and any other counseling deemed appropriate by the agent or the Department of Corrections.
Not to engage in any occupation or participate in a volunteer position that requires you to work or interact primarily and directly with children under the age of 16.
No contact with children under the age of 18 without the agent's consent.
Reimburse up to $10,000 the cost of any necessary professional services related to psychiatric and psychological care and services for A.M.B. pursuant to 973.20(4m).
Comply with sex offender registry.
Sign all releases of information that the agent requires to monitor compliance.
Pay costs.
Pay surcharges.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Provide DNA Sample if requested.
Department of Corrections is authorized to take monies from the prison account for costs/surcharges/restitution.
All computers and hard drives and other contraband recovered and seized in this matter is to be forfeited.
Lifetime supervision is necessary.

Count 4:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 15 years
Initial Confinement for 5 years
Condition of Confinement: Have no contact with A.M.B., her mother, J.B. or her brother J.B. 
Extended Supervision for 10 years
Consecutive to Count 2
0 Days Jail Credit
Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Comply with conditions as stated in Count 2.
Pay costs.
Pay surcharges.
Pay DNA Surcharge.
Provide DNA Sample if requested.

Written explanation of determinate sentence is addressed, copy is given to the Defendant.
Defendant has the right to seek postconviction relief.

All exhibits are accounted for.
Letter in Support of the Defendant from Loretta Button
Letter in Support of the Defendant filed by Atty Jessica Phelps
Letter in Support of the Defendant filed by Atty Jessica Phelps
Sentencing hearing on October 10, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jeremiah J Button in court with Attorney (Atty) Jessica Phelps. Defendant Jeremiah J Button in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Louis John Molepske and Kristian Mukoski appear for the State of Wisconsin.

1:28 PM Court calls case.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

Defendant is prepared to enter pleas into counts.
There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 2 and Count 4. All other counts be dismissed and read in for sentencing purposes.
Court questions State for clarifications as to recommendation.
Atty Molepske replies.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.
Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Atty Phelps has digitally received a copy of the amended information. Defendant concurs.
Defense waives reading of amended information.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

State describes the three assaults referred to, regarding Count 2.
Court takes a moment to review the statutes/definitions.
Court addresses sexual intercourse. Defendant understands.

Defendant enters a plea of:
Count 2: Guilty
Count 4: No Contest

Parties take a moment to discuss plea to Count 4.
Atty Molepske addresses the Court as to the pleas, they are to be guilty, which was part of the agreement.
Atty Phelps states that her client will change his plea to Count 4. 

Court asks the Defendant again what plea he wishes to enter:
As to Count 2: Guilty
As to Count 4: Guilty

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Phelps for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and read in
Count 2: Repeated sexual assault of a child
Count 3: Dismissed and read in
Count 4: Possession of child pornography
Counts 5-13: Dismissed and read in

Neither party is requesting a presentence investigation.
Child victim is out of state and wants to be here for the victim impact statement.
Court will set a sentencing hearing.

State requests bond to be revoked.

BY THE COURT:
Bond is revoked based upon potential prison conviction.

2:00 PM Court is in recess.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
Plea hearing on September 20, 2019 at 01:30 pm.

10:27 AM Defendant Jeremiah J Button in court with Attorney (Atty) Jessica Phelps. Prosecuting District Atttorney Louis Molepske and Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Motion Hearing today is to address the objection filed by the Defense. 
Parties have reached a settlement agreement and the State will file an amended final amended information.  Atty Phelps withdraws her objection to the final amended information.  Plea hearing is set for tomorrow.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 20, 2019 at 01:30 pm.
State's Jury Trial Witness List
Final Amended Information
Defense Objection to State's "Final" Amended Information filed by Atty Jessica Phelps
Motion for Leave to file Final Amend Information

10:53 AM Defendant Jeremiah J Button in court with Attorney (Atty) Jessica Phelps and Atty Anne Renc. Defendant Jeremiah J Button in custody. Prosecuting (DA) District Attorney Louis Molepske and  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motions to Amend Information are address.
Atty Phelps not objecting to the Information conforming dates to the criminal complaint. 
DA Molepske also states the amended information would remove the repeater allegation of count 4.
Court questions dates stated in the amended information.
DA Molepske would like to amend the information dates as stated on the record.
BY THE COURT: Granted

2nd Motion to amend the information is address.
DA Molepske requesting instead of 1 count listing multiple image, it would be amend to 10 total counts of child porn to include data to limit the exact images that was found for each count.
BY THE COURT: Granted to include the additional counts. Court requires the state to file another written amended information.

State's Motion in Limine addressed:

#1 - DA Molepske request to use an exhibit photograph of the victim child during opening statements.
Objections heard by Atty Phelps.
Court will not prevent using a photograph.

#2 - DA Molepske request video statements be allowed with proper foundation.  
Atty Phelps objections stated and victim no longer qualifies for the CAC to be allowed, since the child victim is over the age of 16 yrs old.
BY THE COURT: 908 statute doesn't allow, but if proper foundation is laid out. Court will address then.

#3 - State request presenting the defendant's flight for three years.
Atty Phelps states objection as was not what he is on trial for here.
DA Molepske state there would be two witness and would be brief.
Atty Phelps states one would be sufficient.
BY THE COURT: Believes there is some circumstancial evidence and should be brief

#4 - Granted
#5 - State would need to file quickly.
#6 - Not going to rule on this.

Expert witnessses
Objection stated by Atty Renc on the record. 
State request to testify giving an opinion about the response/demeaner of the victim.
Atty Renc states further objections and has not received a CV and uncertain if an expert witness.
BY THE COURT: Not going to allow, unless more adequate foundation.

Expert Witness Yates - no objections.

Defense Motion in Limine 09--04-2019
#1 Physical evidence or the 9 new images.
BY THE COURT: Orders the DA to make arrangments to have Defense Counsels view the 9 new images.
#2 - Granted
#3 - Granted
#4 - Just follow the statutes.
#5 - Doctor reports - Granted
#6 - State should provide and done by Wedsnesday.
#7 - Same as #1 above.
#8 - Witness Nelson - Not granted, unless it becomes relevant 
#9 - Granted
#10, #11, & 12 - Denied
#13 - already addressed
#14 - already addressed

Defense's 2nd Motion In Limine is address
A & B - Court will allow testimony regards to THC and alcohol.
Prior drug use - Court will allow use with the victim during the time in question.
Sex offender treatment - not an issue.
D, E, F, G, are granted. 

Finalized witness lists to be filed by this Wednesday.
Atty Phelps states objection to any pictures with other children shown in it.
BY THE COURT: The State to have the attorneys look at the pictures today.

Parties to be in chambers in 10 mins for preliminary jury instructions.

9:05 a.m. Defendant Jeremiah J Button in court with Attorney (Atty) Jessica Phelps and Attorney (Atty) Anne Renc. Defendant Jeremiah J Button in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Court calls the case and Atty Molepske states the appearances.

Motion is set today for the recusal of Br 1 Judge.
Atty Anne Renc states her reasons on the record as to why they are requesting the Br 1 Judge recuse himself.
Court makes statements to the parties.
Atty Molepske is heard on the motion for recusal and opposes the motion and states the reasons why on the record.
Court makes further statements on the record.
Defense attorney's filed a speedy trial demand.
Court has time available starting 09/25/19 - Atty Renc will be out of office.
Defense attorney's take time to discuss with their client.
Atty Renc states that they will make the 09/25/19 Jury date work.
Court questions if the parties will have any pre trial motions.
Atty Molespke makes statements with regards to the victim in this case and other issues.
Atty Anne Renc will honor what had been previously done in this case as long as the victim is available for cross-examination.

BY THE COURT:
Motion for Recusal is DENIED.
Final Pre-Trial to be set for 09/16/19 at 10:45 a.m.
State to file and Substantive Jury Instructions by 09/11/19 
Defense to file any proposed jury instructions by 09/11/19 
Court states that any additional motions are to be filed by 09/11/19 but ideally would like them by 09/05/19  Jury trial scheduled for September 25, 2019 at 08:30 am.

1:17  PM Attorney (Atty) Jessica Phelps in court, defendant Jeremiah J Button not in court, in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant appeared via video.

Court questions the defendant if he does not qualify for a public defender what he will be doing for representation.
Defendant states he thought he would qualify for a public defender.
Court informs the defendant what having an attorney represent him can do for himself and his case.
Defendant states that he is not employed and is being supported by his mother.
Defendant would still like to terminate Atty Redfield as his counsel.
Atty Redfield does not have any comments regarding this matter.
Atty Redfield will be willing to share with the public defender any information that he may have.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants the motion for Atty Redfield to terminate his representation of  the defendant.
